author: Staff Reporter
text:
As part of a slew of initiatives being taken by the district administration to increase voter participation, post cards with message on the importance of voting were sent to 10,000 voters across the district on Thursday.

In the message addressed by Collector and District Election Officer K. Veera Ragha Rao, voters were requested to take time amid their busy work and cast their vote without fail in the Assembly election on May 16. The message urged the voters to make Madurai district and the country’s democracy proud by exercising their right to vote. Postcards carrying the message were sent to 1,000 voters in each of the 10 Assembly constituencies in the district. Earlier, Mr. Rao inaugurated a rally from the Madurai Corporation Zone office in Madurai South constituency. The rally, with participants carrying placards with messages on the need to vote, reached the post office in Munichalai, where the cards were posted.
title: Postcards sent to 10,000 voters
